page.title: 18SOCIAL LIFE IN HENLLAN (2)
page.content:
Gardening Club: Formed in 1982, it has 80 members who meet once a month. They visit local gardens and g.centres
The Good Companions Club: Formed in 1976 for the over-60's,it has 50 mem- bers who meet once a fortnight.Dancing singing and bell-ringing are included amongst their activities.
Football Club: Henllan has entered a team in the Denbigh Summer League since its inception in the 1930's. There is no winter - season club.
Many of the village societies meet in the Church Institute, where monthly whist drives attended by c.50 are held Inhabitants arrange fund-raising even- ts for the Clwyd Body Scanner Appeal. The Men's Institute which contained a snooker room closed a decade ago.
